abstract.p: Dr Peter A Olsson letter says attempted murder charges against astronaut Lisa Marie Nowak show that everyone has same human foibles, no matter their training

block.p: Re ''From Spaceflight to Attempted Murder Charge'' (front page, Feb. 7), about Lisa Marie Nowak, the NASA astronaut charged with the attempted murder of a woman she believed to be her rival for the affections of a fellow astronaut:

Re ''From Spaceflight to Attempted Murder Charge'' (front page, Feb. 7), about Lisa Marie Nowak, the NASA astronaut charged with the attempted murder of a woman she believed to be her rival for the affections of a fellow astronaut:

Few readers of The New York Times would be surprised upon some reflection that highly technically trained astronauts are not significantly different from the rest of us complicated bio-psycho-socially-spiritually determined entities.

Brilliant overachievers at NASA have estrogen, testosterone and the challenge that we all have to manage our id urges. Freud, though often glibly nodded to and dismissed, deserves careful study when it comes to all of our human foibles and passions.
As the psychiatrist Harry Stack Sullivan said, ''We are all more simply human than otherwise!''
Peter A. Olsson, M.D. Keene, N.H., Feb. 7, 2007
The writer is an assistant professor of psychiatry at Dartmouth Medical School.
